channel.title: Comments on: Ithaka 2015 Faculty Survey Results

item.title: By: Anneliese Taylor
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description: Ithaka's slides from the presentation are also available; just received the link today: http://www.sr.ithaka.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Equipping-the-researcher-patterns-in-the-UK-and-US_06072016.pdf
item.content:encoded:
Ithaka’s slides from the presentation are also available; just received the link today:
http://www.sr.ithaka.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Equipping-the-researcher-patterns-in-the-UK-and-US_06072016.pdf

item.description: ugh; replying to a post is way too confusing on this platform! this was meant to be a general reply
item.content:encoded: ugh; replying to a post is way too confusing on this platform! this was meant to be a general reply

item.title: By: Ariel Deardorff
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description: If you are interested to see what a local campus version of the survey looks like you can check out UCLA's results here: https://ucsf.box.com/s/lfmzi681t6fiv0k1yrp8p8956xayid2m. Jim and I talked about the possibility of doing Ithaka here at UCSF in addition to or instead of LibQUAL. At the moment we think LibQUAL covers more areas of the library, but it might be interesting to look at doing Ithaka for a certain population or segment of the campus.
item.content:encoded: If you are interested to see what a local campus version of the survey looks like you can check out UCLA’s results here: https://ucsf.box.com/s/lfmzi681t6fiv0k1yrp8p8956xayid2m. Jim and I talked about the possibility of doing Ithaka here at UCSF in addition to or instead of LibQUAL. At the moment we think LibQUAL covers more areas of the library, but it might be interesting to look at doing Ithaka for a certain population or segment of the campus.
